tasks.task: Attend an entomology lecture on sustainable agriculture.
subtasks: Sit and listen to the introduction of Dr. David Pimentel.
Look at slides presented during the lecture.
Process demographic and population growth statistics (world and U.S.).
Consider the impact of pesticides on human health, including poisonings and cancer.
Understand the role of natural enemies and pesticide resistance in agriculture.
Evaluate the environmental effects of pesticides, such as water contamination and species loss.
Analyze the economic benefits and costs of pesticide use.
Explore methods for sustainable pest control, including biological controls and integrated pest management.
Discuss the potential for reducing pesticide use by 50% in the U.S. while maintaining crop yields.
Question and discuss the challenges and feasibility of implementing sustainable agricultural practices in the U.S.
Reflect on the role of public opinion and government policy in promoting sustainable agriculture.
Engage in a Q&A session with Dr. Pimentel.
